feature.label: WatchDog
feature.description: WatchDog is an Eclipse plugin from TU Delft that unobtrusively monitors how Java applications are developed and tested.

By registering and installing WatchDog, you agree to our data retention and privacy policy: - By registering and installing WatchDog, you agree that we store your WatchDog data in a data center of TU Delft, The Netherlands, infinitely until further notice. The data contains information about how you use certain parts of your IDE, mainly in respect to testing, debugging, and static analysis. It is timestamped and contains your IP address. - You can, but are not obliged to, share personal details such as the organization you work for (given permission by your employer) and your email address to receive personalized reports. We never transfer any plain content of either your files or even project or file names. - Only the WatchDog team has access to your raw data. - You grant us the right to perform scientific research on your data, leading to written research papers that might include aggregated user data and graphs, and to release fully anonymized (that is, with no personally linked identifier such as user id, email, or IP address) versions of the submitted WatchDog data. - By default, you grant us the right to store your data infinitely until revocation. - To have your data removed, please simply contact us at info@testroots.org, supplying your user id.
